New Records: Brice Sensabaugh scored 34 points off the bench, a career-high for him.
Bam Adebayo recorded his first game without a single made field goal in over 25 minutes of playing time.
Key Match Events: Brice Sensabaugh led the Utah Jazz with 34 points off the bench on 12 of 18 shooting.
The Miami Heat shot an abysmal 26% from 3-point range and 44% from the field.
The Utah Jazz had a 57-32 rebounding advantage over the Miami Heat.
Post-Match Reflections: The Heat organization has officially hit rock bottom, as they drop Saturday’s game to a tanking 7-25 Jazz squad at home by 36 points.
The Heat fell to 17-16 on the season after the loss, although remained in the East’s sixth seed with a Milwaukee Bucks loss.
The entire franchise just has zero direction now and it isn’t fair to anybody involved.
Miami was already struggling to find a consistent identity all season, and Butler’s fiasco didn’t help that notion.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Heat began the post-Jimmy Butler era by suffering an embarrassing 36-point blowout loss at the hands of the Utah Jazz at home.
The Utah Jazz entered the game with a 7-25 record, good for the 14th seed in the Western Conference and a bottom-three team in the entire association.
